name: regain
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 to take or get possession of something again: The government has regained control of the capital from rebel forces. She made an effort to regain her self-control.
literary to reach or return to a place, especially after difficulty or danger: The swimmers struggled to regain the shore.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter a bad year, she has regained her form.They regained their freedom after ten years of unjust imprisonment.He looked embarrassed for a moment, then quickly regained his poise.They regained the lead in the 21st minute.He lost consciousness after his accident and never regained it.
